attachments.title: [FAB-678] Omit dockerfile in deployment payload · hyperledger/fabric-sdk-node@a8ff8cd · GitHub
attachments.text: Our deployment payloads carry Dockerfile contents in most contexts. This is problematic for a variety of reasons. For example, it assumes that the client is in a position to understand what docke...

apparently it hasn't

it should be merged
the error message posted implies it is running against the new code

Facing similar issue when running the fabric (peer+orderer) in docker containers and node from my laptop.   But using 'peer chaincode  deploy' works fine.    The problem is not there when I run the node and peer0 locally, deploy is successful.

at a high level, im guessing that the chaincodespec.path is being submitted as an empty string, and that worked in the old design because the system didnt bother to analyze it since the dockerfile was already formed
